Spoiler: Vanilla Townie Role PM Example:
Code: Select all
Alignment: Town

Abilities:
1) During every day, you may vote for a player to be removed from the game.

Win Condition: You win when all players who oppose your alignment have been removed from the game.

The game thread is here: [link]
Please confirm that you have read and understand your role in the game thread.


Spoiler: Rules (stolen from Faraday with some modifications who stole them from Hoopla with some modifications):
> Fundamental
1) The site-wide rules apply, please read them and don't do anything stupid.
2) Unless it is explicitly stated in your role PM that you can do so, do not talk about this game outside of the game thread.
3) Do not quote any communication you have with me, the moderator of the game. Depending on the circumstance, you may be able to paraphrase things I have sent you (such as a role PM). Use common sense and if you are unsure feel free to ask me via PM.
4) Be courteous to your fellow player. This is just a game - please don't bring personal grudges into the game. Try and keep it civil. If you cross 'the line' I'll step in. Said line will be judged by me.


> Voting, Lynching & Death
5) For your vote to be counted, it must be bold, and in the form Vote: Hoopla. Caps and colons are optional, but it does need to be bolded. The vote tags are also appropriate for voting.
5a) Broken bold tags won't count. Mispellings or shortened names are ok as long as it is clear who you are voting. If I can't tell who you're voting, it won't count.
6) Unvotes aren't necessary before placing a new vote. Unvotes are necessary if you want to completely remove your vote. Please bold your unvotes or use the unvote tags. It is not necessary to name the player you are unvoting.
7) A lynch will occur when a player achieves 50% +1 of the votes - a majority. When this has happened, any subsequent votes and unvotes will not be counted, and the game will enter twilight. Night will begin as soon as I have declared the lynch.
8) You may vote for a no lynch if desired. If at least 50% of the players in the game vote for a no lynch, the game will progress to night without a lynch.
9) Once you're dead, you are dead. Do not post in the thread until the game is over, not even a 'bah' post.


> Activity & Deadlines
10) Treat this game as a commitment, and try your best to stay active.
11) Prods will be issued after 72 hours in a row without posting. If I keep having to prod you I'll get angry and replace you. Players may request a prod on another player too. I'm human and I may forget so if you want someone prodded just tell me.
11a) If you do not open a prod within 24 hours of it being sent I will begin looking for a replacement.
12) Things come up in life, if you need time off for something, please let myself and the players know in-thread for V/LA purposes. I will be flexible, but if you can't be here for a significant amount of time I will replace you.
13) Deadlines for each game day will be 2 weeks, except day 1 which will have a 3 week deadline.
14) In the event of a deadline ending without a player gaining a majority of votes, there will no lynch. No pluralities for lynching.
15) Nights will have a 48 72 hour deadline. If you fail to send in a night choice, I will automatically default to 'no choice' for that night, and you will do nothing. The night scene may not exactly be up after 48 72 hours, but give or take an hour or 10 and it will be.
16) Deadlines will only be extended if I need a number of replacements, or barring some other freak circumstances. Apart from that, laziness, or anything else, will not result in a deadline extension.


> Other Information
17) These are my colours and font I will use for modly purposes. All other colors are fair game as long as they are easily read by your other players/myself, just don't post a rainbow.
18) I will try to post Vote Counts as often as possible. Hopefully on the top of every page. If you feel a vote count is needed, don't hesitate to ask for one, and I'll provide one at the next opportunity.
19) It's more than possible I've missed a rule or haven't completely covered something. Don't be a prick and try to exploit it, or I will end your existence. Yes that means modkill.
20) I reserve the right to add more, or modify existing rules at any time. If this happens, I will let everyone know.
21) Flavour in night/day write up's is just that; flavour.
22) No cryptography.
23) Have fun!

Dawn. Another boring morning just like any other morning. Or is it...

Role PM's are out, and the thread will now be opening for confirmations. The game will start once everyone has confirmed. Feel free to chat amongst yourselves in the mean time. If I need to, I'll begin looking for replacements after 48-72 hours.

Here we go...

You wake up, stretch your legs, and head out to the cul-de-sac to grab the morning paper. As you step outside, you notice your 13 other neighbors gathered around a giant billboard in the street. It reads:

"Dear Neighbors,

Congratulations! We have been allocated stimulus money to build a new shopping center in our neighborhood. What a huge convenience it will be! Unfortunately, to make room, we will need some of you to leave your homes. Sorry for the trouble, but thanks for taking one for the team

Hoping you are well,
Municipality Administration For Improved Ammenities - Neighborhood Division"


"M.A.F.I.A scum!", you exclaim. "Why can't they just leave well enough alone? Why'd they have to mess with us here?"

Rhinox steps up to calm you down. "Guys, it was gonna happen sooner or later. Might as well accept it and take advantage where we can."

"You! You're the M.A.F.I.A. representative for this neighborhood, aren't you! Get out of here, we don't want you, leave now!"

As you and your neighbors usher Rhinox home to pack his things, a giant wrecking ball swings out of no where barely missing you, but picking up Rhinox on its path through Rhinox's front door. A couple seconds later, the house is destroyed. While you and your neighbors search the rubble for Rhinox's remains, you come across a note:

"Let this serve as a warning to the rest of you. Leave now peacefully, or be forced out one by one. You have one day."

M.A.F.I.A"


Panic sets in. Accusations and threats can be heard a mile away. "We're not leaving!" someone screams. "Are you the MAFIA rep!? You leave!" screams another. Will you be able to kick out the MAFIA and save your homes? Or will your house and remains be buried under the feminine hygiene product aisle of the next big supercenter?

Rhinox, Keeper of the Peace, Demolished Pregame.

1) I keep batshit crazy hours, EST. A student's schedule allows me to sleep late, stay up, and generally let my natural circadian rhythm dictate my sleep/wake cycle, so long as I make class on time and don't fall asleep during it.

With regard to your classification of PR's recent antics as emotional and passionate, the Observer Effect, a conflation of Heisenberg's uncertainty principle, comes into play. The act of observing something changes the object being observed. By similar principles, stating 'Town does this' or 'Scum does that' makes subsequent instances of that rule in that thread less valid. Simply put, scum can and will imitate Town tells to the best of their ability. By sharing one of your Town tells, you give scum clues as to how to fool you. That doesn't render the point completely invalid, as it is still generally true, but I feel PR's outbursts are completely over the top and phony, either trying to play to a supposed Town tell or stymie the efforts of his detractors or both.

Voidedmafia has been lynched!

The day is drawing to a close. It has been a long, exhausting day full of hysterical accusations. The sun is setting in the west. The crimson glow of the setting sun would be beautiful, had it not reminded you of the blood stained wrecking ball hanging in the distance.

All of a sudden, someone stands up. A finger is pointed at Voidedmafia. "You! I saw you last night. You were surveying, measuring your lot. You were making preparations to break ground for the supercenter weren't you? You're MAFIA!"

"No, I, uh..." stammered voided. "I was just doing some landscaping. I was measuring out a plot for a garden."

No one seems to be buying the argument. "A little late to be doing yard work, don't you think?"

"Guys, I'm just your neighbor," refutes voided. "You'll see, the garden plants will be in tonight. I'll call one of you over when they arrive and you'll see I'm not MAFIA!"

A voice calls out from the croud, "Plants or no plants, it doesn't change a thing!"

Defeated, voided sighs and heads off towards his home. "Alright, I'll leave. Just let me grab my things firs..." - he is cut off mid sentence.

"No, you're leaving NOW!" The mob grabs a hold of voided and begins dragging him out of town. Voided breaks free and runs. The mob chases. The chase ends at a ravine. Voided is cornered. "It's over voided. There is no where left to run. Time to leave us to our peaceful town. We don't want the MAFIA here!"

Voided takes one last look at the group. "But... it wasn't even me." He steps off the edge of the cliff, and a few seconds you all hear the sickening thud echoing up and down the ravine.

You all make your way back to town and search voided's home, finding nothing but Gardening for Dummies books. Voided was telling the truth afterall. "It's been a long day," someone remarks. "Let's get some rest, we'll deal with the MAFIA problem tomorrow."

It's 4:00AM. Everyone is enjoying a silent, peaceful night, until... The loud rumbling of an industrial diesel engine engulfs the neighborhood. The neighbors stir, but don't waken. At least not until the crack of the wreckingball crashing through Voidedmafia's front door is heard. Now you're all awake, all of you except Jahudo that is. While most of you quickly head to the basement to attempt to escape the certain doom of the wrecking ball flying through your window next, Jahudo lays in bed peacefully with a smile on his face and his headphones blaring.

It's too bad he was not able to hear the whoosh of the wrecking ball being pulled back into attacking position. The chains moaned under the stress, and then, Bam! In one instance, half of Jahudo's house is gone. While he may have been unable to hear the destruction, the impact shakes the remainder of the house off the foundation and tosses Jahudo onto the floor. Within seconds, he's up and running. Down the stairs. Smash! Another section of the house disappears behind him. The front door is in sight. He rips it open only to find he staring at 50 tons of cold, black iron heading right towards him. Like a scene out of the Matrix, he's on the ground and the wrecking ball swings just above him, destroying the rest of the house. He stands up, relieved, and wipes his brow. Ooops, shoulda looked back. The rebound swing of the wrecking ball drives through jahudo as if he weren't even standing there, and launches him into the night sky.

But all the rest of you hear is the smashing of a second second house, followed by silence as the diesel engine shuts down for the night. The silence doesn't help, none of you sleep much in the next 3 hours before dawn. At dawn, you all head out curious to see what the commotion was about the night before. You notice voided's house is gone, expected due to the previous days activity. But you also find a pile a rubble where jahudo's house used to be. But no Jahudo (somewhere, approximately 3/4 of a mile a way in the forest, his remains dangle from the branches of an oak tree, never to be found). You search the rubble, searching for any clues. All you find is a note:

We WARNED you. Take your stuff, leave now, peacefully. We will clear another lot tonight. It is pointless to resist, you can not stop the development.

~M.A.F.I.A.

I've stayed silent long enough. Yes, I've been quite active on the site and silent here. To be perfectly honest, I've put this off. Why? While doing an archive binge of one of my favorite webcomics, I came across the above strip, specifically the last panel.

I know, it's not exactly applicable. But with a little adjustment, it can easily be applied to Mafia. "Scum don't have scumhunting cases. They have cleverly consistent fictions." The only way I feel someone could have arrive at such a seamless conclusion is with their objective pre-determined prior to making the case. And to put it plainly, Setael's mind was made up far, far before he ever got to my first post.

If you look at his wall case against me, it is largely and strongly based in Xalxe's play, which I have already decried as amateurish and misleading. When I replaced in, I decided to read the thread before looking at my role PM. I was fairly convinced at that time that Xalxe had pulled scum and that pappum's rat was our partner. The rest of the case comes from that conclusion, after which all of my posts were irrelevant except as fodder for advancing his case.

Next post in a series of three: Why I hammered, and the case for Voided as Town that I never finished. The third will be answering the remaining questions and a final statement.

Pine has been lynched!

It was barely mid-day. After a morning of the typical accusations, you go your separate ways for lunch. One of you decides to take the time to spy on Pine, see what he's up to. Surprisingly, Pine was showing a particularly suspicious interest in the wrecking ball that has been wrecking havok on the town. The alarm is quickly sounded, and you all rush over and surround Pine.

"I was... I was just trying to figure out how to stop it," he protests! "I have secret poweres to do these things!"

"Oh yeah?", someone asks. "If you thought you knew how to stop it, why didn't you tell us sooner?"

As the townsfolk turn to ignore Pine and talk amongst themselves, no one sees Pine pull the wrecking ball remote control out of his pocket. "Screw it," Pine laments. "They'll get no more out of me."

Pine turns to the town and exclaims, "I'm not sorry for what I've done. Or... what I'm ABOUT TO DO!" With a press of a single button, a loud crack is heard, and the wrecking ball falls out of the sky, landing directly on Pine's head.

You don't bother to wonder whether Pine ended his own life, or if the machine suffered an unfortunate malfunction. He was MAFIA, and he was gone. You all spend the rest of the day celebrating. You light Pine's house ablaze, and roast marshmellows over the glowing embers. Night falls, and you all head off to bed wondering, is this the end of the MAFIA in this neighborhood?

Pine, Mafia Goon, Crushed Day 2

It is now Night 2. Night actions due Saturday, April 16th at 11:00PM EST. If your role PM allows you to talk at night, you may do so now.

The way things have been going, you kind of figured it wasn't going to be a quiet night. neil1113 certainly wasn't expecting to get any sleep. He lay awake in bed, wondering if he would make it through the night.

He sprung to life at the sound of glass breaking once, twice, then a third time. He rushes down stairs to find that someone has thrown through his window some burning planks of wood from the bonfire at pine's house the night before, and the flames have already engulfed the first floor of his house cutting off his exits. He runs back up stairs and shuts the bathroom door behind him. He gets in the shower and turns on the water - smart move, stops the flames, but doesn't stop the smoke which is entering the room around the cracks in the door. He's got one option left - jumping from the second story window. The fall wouldn't be pleasant, but it wouldn't kill him. Without thinking, he took a leap - right into his giant rose bush, the white pedals now stained red with blood. Just a couple weeks ago the landscapers put it in. Stupid mistake. It's like being wrapped in barbed wire - every move neil makes to free himself only digs the thorns in deeper. He screams, but there is no one to answer his call for help. Slowly, the life drains out of him, and everything goes black.

neil1113, Vanilla Town, Shredded Night 2.

Across the cul-de-sac, tarsonisocelot is pouring himself a glass of Jack, on the rocks. Well, almost a glass - he had been working on the bottle all night and there wasn't but a swallow left. It's bright in the kitchen, but the lights are out. The flames pouring out of neil's house now are lighting up world like its mid day. tarsonis stumbles over to the door and opens it to check out the devastation - instead he finds himself staring down the barrel of some kind of pistol. A shot rings out, and tarsonis falls. Somehow, it doesn't kill him right away. He was fading in and out of consciousness as he was drug back into his house. He recognizes the familiar odor of the cool liquid that burns is skin - Gasoline. He sees the flash of bright orange and then the burn as flames engulf his body. It the worst pain he would ever feel, but the part of his brain that should care is already shutting down. He thought he recognized who it was standing over his burning body for just a second, but the light went out before he could even feel surprised.

tarsonisocelot, Town 1-shot Vigilante, Burnt to a crisp Night 2.

The rest of you wake up to the devastation. Most of you are just glad it wasn't you. But a thought weighs heavy on your mind. In tarsonis' front yard, another message has been scorched into the lawn:

HOW MANY MORE HAVE TO DIE?


Well?

Chkflip wasn't having a very good day. He had been traumatized by all the goings on in this neighborhood the past days and nights. When the group approached him to ask about the suspicious burns on his hands, he just folded. "You guys want me to leave? Fine! I'll just go..." And Chkflip grabbed his bag and followed the tracks leading out of town.

"Well that was underwhelming", everyone thought. Maybe the M.A.F.I.A. is giving up? You search through his things and don't find anything suspicious at all. You don't have time to dwell on the thought as burning logs fly through the windows. You all barely make it out alive. As you head to bed, you realize you can't remember who was missing while Chkflip's house was being searched. "Guess the MAFIA aren't gone yet afterall", you think as your mind drifts off to sleep, wondering who's not going to make it through the night.

chkflip andrew94, Vanilla Town, Kicked out of his house Day 3 (lynched).

Night is over and the scene is coming right up.

Screams pierce through the night in the neighborhood once again. Most of you don't even flinch. You know the drill by now. Its not you, so there's no need to worry. Right? Eventually, the screams stop, the silence of night returns, and you drift back to sleep.

You're the last one out to the cul-de-sac in the morning. Your neighbors are gathered around some object. You notice one is missing. You push your way through and find Nacho, strapped to a kitchen chair, clearly dead. His skin has the appearance of being melted off his body, but there are no burns. Someone dragged him out here in the middle of the night and poured a bucket of hydrochloric acid over his head. You think back to last night and the horrifying screams you heard. What a horrible way to go.

A message is scrawled next to nacho on the street, in sidewalk chalk, no less.

No more warnings. No more games. We can't be stopped, and it seems you're no longer trying. We're going to enjoy removing the rest of you. Farewell.

Cecily, Vanilla Town, Lynched the old-fashioned way Day 4

Night fell. You all went to bed, except for Faraday. He spent the early night, wandering around the neighborhood, wondering what would happen next. Would this be the night it was all over?

He came across havingfitz, hiding in some bushes, acting all shady. fitz stepped out from behind the bushes and met Faraday head on. Seconds passed, but it seemed like hours. A gun was drawn, then a shot fired. A body fell to the ground.

As the life was fading from the body on the ground, he managed to catch a glimpse of his attacker heading into mikemike778's house. Inside the house, mike heard the door open as he was lying in bed. He heard the footsteps coming up the stairs. He saw the figure enter his room, with a gun in his hand. Terrified, mike trembled out a few words: "Are... are.. you gonna kill me?" The gun started to raise. Mike closed his eyes, knowing it was the end. Nothing happened. He opened his eyes and realized the figure was simply switching on the light. It took a few seconds for mike's eyes to come into focus. Then he saw, it was Faraday standing before him.

Faraday spoke to mike, "You idiot, I'm the one you've been helping all day! The M.A.F.I.A. is impressed with your actions here. You've helped us get the job done. fitz is dead, help me take out the rest of these fools and then we'll get this shopping center built, you and me."

The rest was a formality. Bub and Setael were murdered in their sleep. Their bodies along with fitz's and any other remains that could be found were buried deep under the land where the super shopping center would be built. A week later, ground was broke and the foundation was laid, sealing all evidence out of sight forever.

The End?

mikemike got the unique role, being bother a traitor who didn't know the goons and a neighborizer. My intention was, the traitor would use the neighborizer ability to try to neighborize a goon. The 1-shot for both neighborizers only counted as a shot if they successfully created a neighbor. The neighborizer action happens last after night kills, so if a player the neighborizer targeted was killed, the neighborizer attempt would fail and thus not count as a shot. However, the 1-shot vig mechanic was such that it counted as a shot if you pm'ed me a target - if it failed, the shot was gone. Thats why I didn't want to answer the 1-shot mechanic questions. But hey, I'm a new mod, I can learn things too. Going forward, I'll have a policy of not answering questions about anything that would be included in a role PM. 1-shot mechanics, included in a role PM. Gunsmith mechanics, included in a role PM. role interactions I'm still up in the air about. Me answering about the tracker interaction expedited Pine's lynch it seemed, even though I don't see how my answer should have conflicted with what Pine said in-thread. I felt bad about that though. In general I felt like I was more involved than a mod should be in a game, and in future games I need to decide pre-game what questions I will and won't answer and how I will answer them, or just have a blanket "don't answer anything" rule.
